posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
I've been thinking about optimizing lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about optimizing that came up in our game last night.

I'm trying to create an optimized character focused on optimizing. What race/class/feat combinations would you recommend?

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about optimizing?

posts.author: WizardlyWisdom
posts.content:
I've been playing a Half-Orc Bard in my campaign, and I've noticed that build really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

In our last session, we encountered a Basilisk and tried to use build to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

When DMing, I like to use build as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about build. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with build that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.content:

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about optimizing. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for build are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that build functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of build to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.
